data.meta_description: Download Images of Grace Darmond - Free for commercial use, no attribution required. From: A scene from "The Beautiful Gambler" (SAYRE 14507) to {{to}.
data.text:
A scene from the American western film The Beautiful Gambler (1921), which played at the Clemmer Theater, Seattle. Includes Grace Darmond and Harry Van Meter. Dated June 30, 1921. Subjects: motion pictures, a More

A scene from the American drama film Below the Surface (1920), which played at the Strand Theater, Seattle. Includes Grace Darmond and Hobart Bosworth. Date stamped July 8, 1920. Subjects: motion pictures, ac More

Advertisement for the American drama film The Crucible of Life (1918) with Grace Darmond and unidentified actors, on page 39 of the January 11, 1918 Variety.

This is one of the few surviving film fragments from The Gulf Between (1917), the first Technicolor movie and the only one made to be publicly shown by the additive two-color method. The frame seen comes from More

Lobby card for the American action film Wide Open (1927). The item has no copyright markings on it as can be seen in the links above. United States Copyright Office page 2 "Visually Perceptible Copies The noti More

Grace Darmond as Marjorie Stanton in the American film serial A Dangerous Adventure (1920). Postcard from Max B. Sheffer Card Co. (Chicago) Movie Stars Postcard Set (1922). Size of postcard: 3.25-by-5.5-inches More

Still from the American adventure film serial A Dangerous Adventure (1922) with Grace Darmond, on page 32 of the February 18, 1922. The caption lists the film by an apparent early working title of Shadows of the Jungle.

Advertisement for the American comedy film So Long Letty (1920) with T. Roy Barnes, Colleen Moore, Grace Darmond, and Walter Hiers, from the insert after page 18 of the October 16, 1920 Exhibitors Herald.

Advertisement for the American drama film The Song of Life (1922) with Gaston Glass, Grace Darmond, Georgia Woodthorpe, and Wedgwood Nowell, on pages 28 and 29 of the March 25, 1922 Exhibitors Herald.

Advertisement for the American comedy film Handle with Care (1922) with Grace Darmond and Landers Stevens, on pages 16 and 17 of the February 4, 1922 Exhibitors Herald.

Advertisement for the American film serial The Hope Diamond Mystery (1921) with Grace Darmond, on pages 14 and 15 of the March 19, 1921 Exhibitors Herald.

Advertisement for the American comedy film See My Lawyer (1921) with T. Roy Barnes and Grace Darmond, the other actors are not identified, from the insert after page 6 of the April 2, 1921 Exhibitors Herald.

Ad for the American film What Every Woman Wants (1919) with Grace Darmond and Forrest Stanley, on page 1595 of the March 22, 1919 Moving Picture World.

Still from the American drama film Below the Surface (1920) with Grace Darmond, Lloyd Hughes, George Webb (1887â€“1943), and Hobart Bosworth, on page 72 of the June 5, 1920 Exhibitors Herald.
